result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rod Lee Steffen

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Rod Lee Steffen in court.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Rod Lee Steffen.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Offer received. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Notice To Person Posting Bond Money
DEFENDANTS DEMAND FOR DISCOVERY AND INSPECTION
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jason Daane
Original Warrant filed with the court.
See signature bond for conditions

DEFENDANT MUST POST $250 CASH
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM M.L.L. dob 5/25/1994 OR RESIDENCE. NO CONTACT WITH WITNESS J.C.K. dob 7-31-1971. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rod Lee Steffen in court, in custody by video. Attorney Jason Daane for bond purposes only. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Bond set with cash component and same prior conditions. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
